section.title: Introduction
section.para: The ajf-forge is in fact a plugin for JBOSS FORGE which is a powerful project building tool. With this plugin you will be able to easily generate an empty ajf2 project, instantly deployable on a local tomcat server. It gives you the key to a "ready to use" ajf2 project.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Installing the Jboss Forge tool will allow you to use the ajf-forge plugin.

section.title: Install forge distribution
section.para: First, download the Jboss forge distribution here :
Unzip the forge distribution in you C:/appli directory.

section.title: Set environment variables
section.para: You have add JBoss distribution's bin directory to the build path of your system. After right clicking on your workstation and go in properties/Environment variable section, create a variable FORGE_HOME, targeting the forge distribution directory
After that you have to add "%FORGE_HOME%/bin" to your system's path. To do so, just mofiy the "Path" environment variable :

section.title: Run JBOSS forge tool
section.para: Now you are ready to use the JBOSS Forge tool. For that, just launch a command terminal and set the 'forge' command :

section.title: Install ajf-forge plugin
section.para: Now you are able to use the forge tool, you just need to install the ajf-forge plugin.

section.title: Download ajf-forge plugin
section.para: First and foremost, you have to download the zip file of the plugin here :
Then, launch forge in order to see your working directory of FORGE. This is simply logged on you terminal each time you launch forge.
